attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The SARB has a statutory mandate to enhance and protect financial stability in South Africa. The SARB is also responsible for:

body.value:
The SARB has a statutory mandate to enhance and protect financial stability in South Africa.

The SARB is also responsible for:

  • Issuing and destroying banknotes and coin;
  • Regulating and supervising financial institutions;
  • Managing the official gold and foreign reserves of the country;
  • Managing the national payments system;
  • Administering the countrys remaining exchange rate control systems;
  • Acting as the banker to the government; and
  • Acting as lender of last resort to provide liquidity assistance in exceptional cases.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Undertaking an impressive range of global construction projects, the company has worked across various sectors, providing infrastructure solutions for transport, military, education, and security businesses, among others.

body.value:
Undertaking an impressive range of global construction projects, the company has worked across various sectors, providing infrastructure solutions for transport, military, education, and security businesses, among others.

In Brazil, the company completed high-profile contracts at municipal, state, and federal levels, as well as serving the private market. With over 1,000 direct employees in Brazil, it has delivered multiple complex projects, including urban design upgrades, sanitation and public housing programs, airport and port facilities, rail and road overpasses, and train and subway stations. Additionally, the real estate department has developed both residential and commercial buildings, showcasing the company's adaptability to the diverse needs of its client base.

attributes.content: Cape Winelands Airport Authority | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Cape Winelands Airport, formerly Fisantekraal Airfield, is an ex-South African Air Force airfield built in 1943 and used to operate Lockheed Ventura bombers. It has been in private ownership since 1993 and serves as a general flying airfield for flight training in Cape Town. Fixed wing and helicopter schools, Air Mercy Services' Pilatus PC-12 from Cape Town International (FACT) and Morningstar airfield (Morningstar Flight Academy) also visit for circuit and emergency training. Private and company aircraft occasionally pick up or drop passengers at Cape Winelands Airport.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The State Fuel and Power Corporation (SFPC) was established in 1964 under the then Ministry of Water, Construction, Land, and Environment by Presidential Decree No. 12 of 1964. It was tasked with managing power stations and providing services on both islands. Sector reform under Act No.3 of 2006 transferred regulatory issues from the utility to the parent ministry and established the Zanzibar Electricity Corporation (ZECO), thereby replacing SFPC, to facilitate the generation, transmission, transformation, distribution, supply, and use of electricity in the Islands of Zanzibar.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: MCA is a Portuguese group founded in 1998 in Guimares. The name of the company derives from its founder, the entrepreneur Manuel Couto Alves, who currently serves as Chairman of the Company. The initial core activity was the construction of infrastructure facilities, such as roads, bridges, water and sanitation, civil, maritime, power, and electrical facilities. In 2006, MCA began its internationalization process, with Angola taking a predominant role. The company has since expanded its activities across Europe, Africa, and the Americas.

body.value:
MCA is a Portuguese group founded in 1998 in Guimares. The name of the company derives from its founder, the entrepreneur Manuel Couto Alves, who currently serves as Chairman of the Company. The initial core activity was the construction of infrastructure facilities, such as roads, bridges, water and sanitation, civil, maritime, power, and electrical facilities.

In 2006, MCA began its internationalization process, with Angola taking a predominant role. The company has since expanded its activities across Europe, Africa, and the Americas.

In 2021, with the consolidation of its strong commitment to the Energies business, MCA embarked on an ambitious path of realigning its strategy and governance model.

Today, MCA is focused on further developing the businesses of renewable energies, circular economy, urban development, and health.

In 2021, with the consolidation of its strong commitment to the Energies business, MCA embarked on an ambitious path of realigning its strategy and governance model.

body.value:
Enugu State government, led by an elected governor, is committed to promoting sustainable development and improving the quality of life for its residents. The government focuses on various sectors including education, healthcare, infrastructure, agriculture, and tourism. Initiatives to enhance road networks, provide clean water, improve healthcare facilities, and support agricultural productivity are among the key priorities.

Education is a major focus, with Enugu hosting several higher institutions, including the University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN), one of the country's premier universities. The state government supports these institutions through funding and developmental projects aimed at fostering academic excellence and innovation.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: PRDW is an international group of consulting engineers specializing exclusively in the fields of port and coastal engineering. Established in 1992 in Cape Town, South Africa, PRDW operates globally with offices in South Africa, Chile, Australia, USA, Mozambique, and Brazil.

body.value:
PRDW is an international group of consulting engineers specializing exclusively in the fields of port and coastal engineering. Established in 1992 in Cape Town, South Africa, PRDW operates globally with offices in South Africa, Chile, Australia, USA, Mozambique, and Brazil.

The firm provides a comprehensive range of consulting engineering services, including investigations, planning, feasibility studies, basic and detailed design, preparation of tender documents, supervision of construction, and post-construction monitoring. PRDW's expertise covers marine structures, oceanography, wave conditions, coastal processes, physical and mathematical modeling, as well as navigation and port planning studies. They also offer services in contracts, specifications, and cost estimates, ensuring high-quality solutions tailored to the specific needs of port and coastal projects worldwide.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Government of Ekiti State, Nigeria operates under a democratic framework comprising three branches: the executive, led by Governor Biodun Oyebanji, focuses on executing laws and managing state affairs with the support of a Deputy Governor and an Executive Council. The legislative branch, known as the Ekiti State House of Assembly, is a unicameral body responsible for law-making. The judicial branch, including the High Court, Magistrate Courts, and Customary Courts, interprets and applies the law. Ekiti State is divided into 16 local government areas, each governed by elected councils.

body.value: The Government of Ekiti State, Nigeria operates under a democratic framework comprising three branches: the executive, led by Governor Biodun Oyebanji, focuses on executing laws and managing state affairs with the support of a Deputy Governor and an Executive Council. The legislative branch, known as the Ekiti State House of Assembly, is a unicameral body responsible for law-making. The judicial branch, including the High Court, Magistrate Courts, and Customary Courts, interprets and applies the law. Ekiti State is divided into 16 local government areas, each governed by elected councils. Key focus areas for the state government include education, healthcare, infrastructure development, agriculture, and economic growth, with initiatives like the Ekiti Knowledge Zone and various social investment programs aimed at addressing challenges such as economic dependency, infrastructure deficits, unemployment, and security issues.

body.value:
Power Construction Corporation of China (POWERCHINA) is an integrated construction group specializing in investment and financing, planning and design, engineering construction, equipment manufacturing, and operation management. The company's focus areas include clean and low-carbon energy, water resources, environmental construction, and infrastructure.

Centered around hydroelectricity and electric power, POWERCHINA has diversified its market presence into various segments. These segments feature comprehensive civil engineering and large construction projects, encompassing water environment management, smart cities, rail transit projects, municipal engineering, and residential buildings. This broad scope of integrated business development positions POWERCHINA as a leading entity in its industry.

body.value:
Raubex, a prominent infrastructure development and construction materials supply group in South Africa, was established in 1974 and publicly listed on the JSE in March 2007. Operating extensively across southern Africa and Western Australia, Raubex is recognized as a Level 1 B-BBEE group, employing over 7,000 professionals.

The company's mission is to lead the African market in road and civil engineering contracting, as well as in the provision of construction materials and mining services, while consistently meeting stakeholder expectations. Raubex comprises four key divisions: Roads and Earthworks Division, Construction Materials Division, Materials Handling and Mining Division, and Infrastructure Division. The group is committed to upholding high standards of integrity, professionalism, and quality across all its operations

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Park Lane Construction, LLC is a general contracting company specializing in the construction and development of light commercial and multi-family properties.

body.value:
Park Lane Construction, LLC is a general contracting company specializing in the construction and development of light commercial and multi-family properties.

The history of the company dates back to 1991 when Chester Parker formed Park Lane Construction, Inc. primarily as a construction services company. In 2008, Scott Parker purchased the majority of the assets from his father and established a new entity, Park Lane Construction, LLC. To date, Park Lane Construction has built over 3,000 units of conventional market, senior living, university housing, affordable tax-credit, bond, State HOME, FHA, and HUD-financed multi-family properties, with project costs ranging from $500,000 to over $20,000,000.

The officers of Park Lane Construction, Chester L. Parker, Jr. and P. Scott Parker, possess a combined experience of over forty years in the residential, multi-family residential, and commercial construction and development fields. Their experience spans a geographic area from Georgia to California and from Wisconsin to Florida.

body.value:
Ctce Group is a large comprehensive construction company with operations both domestically and internationally. It serves as a model and benchmark subsidiary of China Railway Group Limited (CREC), a Fortune Global 500 company. By the end of 2018, the group's annual new marketing value and production capacity both reached RMB 1000 billion.

Licenses and Certifications: Ctce Group holds 95 contracting licenses and certificates, encompassing a range of fields such as railway, highway, housing, municipal works, and electric installation engineering. Notably, the group possesses four super general contracting certificates in railway, highway, housing, and municipal works, making it the first company in Anhui Province to achieve this distinction. Additionally, Ctce Group holds international contracting licenses and marketing certificates, allowing it to engage in diverse business activities.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: I&M Bank was established in 1974 as a financial services company before transitioning into a commercial bank. It is now a wholly-owned subsidiary of I&M Group PLC (formerly I&M Holdings PLC), a public company listed on the Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE). The bank boasts a rich heritage in the banking sector, evolving from a community financial institution into a major regional commercial bank that offers a comprehensive range of corporate and retail banking services.

body.value:
I&M Bank was established in 1974 as a financial services company before transitioning into a commercial bank. It is now a wholly-owned subsidiary of I&M Group PLC (formerly I&M Holdings PLC), a public company listed on the Nairobi Securities Exchange (NSE). The bank boasts a rich heritage in the banking sector, evolving from a community financial institution into a major regional commercial bank that offers a comprehensive range of corporate and retail banking services.

Since June 2013, I&M Bank's shares have been publicly traded on the Nairobi Stock Exchange following the acquisition of its entire shareholding by I&M Group PLC. This transition marked a significant milestone in the bank's history, solidifying its position as a key player in the regional banking landscape.
